entry.title: [Office upload] Move fake ODFS test classes to file_manager_test_util.h
entry.content:
Move FakeExtensionProviderOneDrive and FakeProvidedFileSystemOneDrive

test classes to file_manager_test_util.h so they can be shared with

OneDriveUploadHandlerTest, as well as OneDriveTest.



The purpose of FakeExtensionProviderOneDrive is to ensure

FakeProvidedFileSystemOneDrive is mounted as the fake ODFS. Add

CreateFakeProvidedFileSystemOneDrive() to mount a

FakeExtensionProviderOneDrive and return a pointer to it. This can be

used to call any necessary functions, such as AddEntry().



Update both classes to be less hardcoded so both OneDriveTest and

OneDriveUploadHandlerTest can use them.



Bug: b/288022200

entry.content:

for WrappedSkImageBacking which in turn causes skia flush

and hence cache access.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Starting filling V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder::Decode()
entry.content:
This CL starts writing some code in said method, concretely to

pass DecoderBuffers into the OUTPUT queue. This CL does not

support H.264/5 (for that we'd need a fragment splitter, and that

will be added later on). It also does not recycle queue slots.

It does poke for events, concretely for V4L2_EVENT_SOURCE_CHANGE

which will be used in later CLs to configure the CAPTURE queue.



A new test case is added to v_d_a_tests to exercise this simple

functionality.



Tested on hana and trogdor via:

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests /usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8 '--vmodule=*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=4' --gtest_filter=*.Decode --enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder



-- also tested on cherry since this CL introduces a new test.



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: Ib313bd948b4170d6ff5cf2d63bfa7669013993b8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4651677

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning]: Correct handling of unavailable offline Google
entry.content:
files.



File task uses checkAvailability_ method to verify two things: (1) if

a given file is available either locally or via network and (2) if it is

available via the network, if the connection is metered. In the latter

case it asks the user to approve using metered connection. The approval

is communicated via a fulfilled promise, while lack of approval is

communicated via rejected promise. However, if the file is not available

locally and there is no connectivity this method simply shows the dialog

informing the user about the file not being available, but still returns

a fulfilled promise. This CL fixes that flow by returning a rejected

promise if a file is not available locally and the chromebook is

offline.



Screencast: http://screencast/cast/NTAzOTkxNDAzNTk3MDA0OHxmMGEzYjYxNC0xOQ

entry.title: [wpt-metadata] Allow disabling lint errors in metadata
entry.content:
This change allows users to opt-out of metadata lint rules and was

largely inspired by `pylint: disable`. To disable a rule, add a comment

of the form:



lint-wpt: disable=, , ...



for the desired scope. The wildcard '*' will disable all rules.



Bug: 1454887

entry.title: Stop recreating ConciergeClient in LockToSingleUserManagerTest
entry.content:
Before CL:4654082, the test needed to initialize ConciergeClient at the

end of SetUp(), because otherwise ArcSessionManager was registered as a

VmObserver in its constructor and caused ArcSessionLockTest and

NeverLockTest to fail. See CL:4654082's description for how it affected

the test's behavior.



Now VmObservers other than LockToSingleUserManager do not affect the

test, and thus we can just initialize ConciergeClient at the top of

SetUp() in a usual way and remove a long-standing TODO.



Bug: None

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="LockToSingleUserManagerTest.*"



Change-Id: Ie9cf58784dab1a897114c708b5b9603f71882921

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4653916

Reviewed-by: Victor-Gabriel Savu

entry.title: Simplify scale factor logic for ARC
entry.content:
Currently, the display scale factor logic applies scaling

transform to the host window, which causes the submitted

CompositorFrame to be scaled up and then down again.



This change applies display scale factor transform to the

root surface, instead of the host window.



Analogous to crrev.com/c/4630949 but for ARC instead of Lacros.



TEST=Connect an external monitor.

- Set different scale factors between the two monitors.

- Open Lacros, move it between the two monitors.

- Verify that rounded corners, shadows and UI elements

are properly sized, scaled and clipped.

- Also, open ARC apps and verify those are properly scaled too.

- ARC notifications are also scared correctly in both monitors.



BUG=1450006



Change-Id: I0cb35ceb91958d89920fe36e6b6e5b207f31a084

entry.title: Fix middle-click issues on a SystemWebDialog in ChromeOS
entry.content:
This CL fixes the following issues on the "Add Google Account" dialog:

1) If Lacros is disabled, ctrl+clicking on the "Incognito window" link

opens extra Ash window.

2) If Lacros is disabled, middle-click on the "Incognito window" link

opens a normal browser instead of an incognito window.

3) In LacrosOnly, middle-clicking on the "Guest mode" link opens an Ash

browser window.

4) In LacrosOnly, middle-clicking on links doesn't close the dialog.



The issue 1) is fixed by calling `preventDefault()` in the click

handler. The issues 2), 3) and 4) are fixed by making middle-clicks have

the same effect as ctrl-click.



Bug: 1457122, 1453971, b/288021165

Change-Id: Ide1b16868b6b49bac9042d68a5d7a7d0fa4b09c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4634805

Reviewed-by: Georg Neis

Reviewed-by: Kush Sinha

Commit-Queue: Jun Ishiguro

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1164498}

entry.title: Revert "[reland] [rust] chrome://crash/rust on ChromeOS"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6976254d80ae5af825eb4a80afa657627017ad4c.



Reason for revert: Primary culprit of blocking uprev by breaking chromeos cqs. See b/289420795 for details.



Original change's description:

> [reland] [rust] chrome://crash/rust on ChromeOS

>

> This enables the first bytes of Rust in the Chromium binary itself

> for ChromeOS. It simply enables a chrome://crash/rust URI handler

> which users should not normally encounter.

>

> We're enabling this carefully and progressively across platforms.

>

> This is a reland of

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4624431

> which was reverted because parts of Chrome OS are still on python

> 3.6 and one of our Rust build scripts required Python 3.7.

>

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647335

> removes the dependency on Python 3.7 and will land before this

> relanding CL.

>

entry.title: graphite: Fix incorrect YUV-RGB conversion capability check
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/4612331 added a check in CopyRGBATextureToVideoFrame

for supports_yuv_rgb_conversion to early out when not supported. This

check is only correct for OOP raster. Non-OOP raster can still use a

fallback path that does the conversion using Skia over GL decoder. This

CL fixes the check and should fix tast failures seen on ChromeOS.

entry.title: InlineLayout: add initial support for inline text-box-trim
entry.content:
This CL implements the initial support for the text-box-trim property.

More specifically, it makes blink calculate the half-leading of inline

boxes based the value of its text-box-trim property.



If the property asks to trim the half-leading from the start/end side

of the box, half-leading will be treated as 0, to match the text-over baseline/text-under baseline.



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eT0xEOrfVI3RhZ6goJLW1yOWHXLBq2tzAYrHe3NIiO8/edit



Bug: 1411581

Change-Id: I3c7f5a1bfcdfe75b2b84a73ebdc81e53e973d69a

entry.title: [bfcache] Enable `BFCachePolicy` on Android
entry.content:
After this CL, the `BFCachePolicy` for PerformanceManager on Android

will be enabled. The foreground_cache_size will be updated from 6 to 0

to allow the policy dynamically adjust bfcache entries based on memory

pressure.



See latest exp results at https://crbug.com/1395281#c33

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Rebaseline text failures for reftests
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/4367918 broke text rebaselining for reftests that produce

both text and image output [0]. This change narrows the reftest skipping

condition to image failures only in a later stage of each task.



Also, disambiguate the `REFTEST_FAILURE` reason as

`REFTEST_IMAGE_FAILURE`.



[0]: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/testing/writing_web_tests.md#tests-that-are-both-pixel_reference-tests-and-text-tests

entry.title: Prerender UKM: Exclude kPrerendering to record UKMs for cookies
entry.content:
This patch explicitly excludes the kPrerendering lifecycle state to

record cookie related UKMs. Current code calls GetPageUkmSourceId

for all cases, but the method returns an ID that will not be associated

with any URL while prerendering. This behavior follows our data

collection policy.

entry.title: Prerender UKM: Ensure LinkToText doesn't calls GetPageUkmSourceId
entry.content:
GetPageUkmSourceId doesn't expect it is called while prerendering, and

returned ID will not be bound with any URL if it is called.



As LinkToText seems not being used while prerendering, we add CHECK

to ensure the method is called only when the page is not in the

prerendering state.



Also convert existing DCHECK to follow the up-to-date guildelines.



Bug: 1245014

entry.title: Prerender UKM: RFHI internal GetPageUkmSourceId uses while prerendering
entry.content:
There are two internal callers who may call GetPageUkmSourceId()

also while prerendering. It returns an ID that will not be associated

with any URL.



This patch modifies these callers to use ukm::kInvalidSourceId

explicitly as the final preparation to have a state CHECK in

GetPageUkmSourceId() to avoid developers' mistakes.

entry.title: [Extensions + Service Workers] Don't try to update extension SWs
entry.content:
Extension service workers are managed through the extension system; they

are registered and unregistered as the extension is loaded and

unloaded in the user profile, and are updated when the full extension

package is updated.



The service worker layer still tries to periodically update extension

service workers when it detects the registration as "stale". Normally,

this is a no-op, because:

* If the extension code hasn't changed, it views it as "no update"

* If the extension code has changed (independent of an extension

update), we mark the extension as corrupted and disable it.



However, there are exceptions to this for off-store extensions, such

as local unpacked extensions. In this case, an update call could see

a changed file, which would then be treated as a service worker update.

This results in a second worker context being created for this new

"waiting" worker, which violates expectations in the extensions system.



To avoid this, don't try to update extension service workers.



Also add a regression test for the unpacked extension case.



Bug: 1271154

entry.title: Fix UAF when exiting a nested run loop in TabDragContextImpl::OnGestureEvent.
entry.content:
OnGestureEvent may call ContinueDrag, which may run a nested run loop. After the nested run loop returns, multiple seconds of time may have passed, and the world may be in a very different state; in particular, the window that contains this TabDragContext may have closed.



This CL checks if this has happened, and returns early in that case.

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in VerdictCacheManagerTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

entry.title: Reland "Cache Live Translate translation requests"
entry.content:
This CL contains the following changes to the original CL:

- Remove the IsFullyTerminatedSentence(). Both `base::BreakIterator`

and `icu::BreakIterator` use the third-party Unicode Text Access

API, which determines if a string ends in a sentence by checking

the character after the last character of a string which causes

the MSan bot to throw a use-of-uninitialized-value error. Because

partial recognition strings returned by SODA do not typically end

in a full sentence, IsFullyTerminatedSentence() isn't necessary.

Instead, all of the sentences except for the last sentence in a

partial recognition string are cached.

- Expand test coverage.



This reverts commit ea475592bb3d28628cec299ffd8ec8001e7b6f2f.



Reason for revert: Fixing MSan failure.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Cache Live Translate translation requests"

>

> This reverts commit 9169a09f44951b5500c051a644e590696bd3034c.

>

> Reason for revert: LiveTranslate tests are failing on MSan and LSan

> bots.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Cache Live Translate translation requests

> >

> > This CL introduces a cache that is used to reduce translating duplicate

> > strings for the Live Translate feature. This cache reduces the number of

> > characters sent to the translation service by ~81% without affecting

> > the user experience.

> >

> > Bug: 1426899

> > Change-Id: I4780aa71e827c0b1c6683d155f46f8ebdbd52d2d

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4632927

entry.title: WebUI: Simplify the names and class structure of cr_elements/ tests.
entry.content:
Now that cr_elements_browsertest.cc is no longer auto-generated by

js2gtest, a simpler pattern can be used that does not require each test

case to use a different C++ class name.



Example renames for browser_tests:

CrElementsButtonTest.All -> CrElementsTest.CrButton

CrElementsToggleTest.All -> CrElementsTest.CrToggle

CrElementsDialogTest.All -> CrElementsTest.CrDialog



Example renames for interactive_ui_tests

CrElementsActionMenuTest.All -> CrElementsFocusTest.CrActionMenu

CrElementsCheckboxTest.All -> CrElementsFocusTest.CrCheckbox



Where the somewhat meaningless "*.All" naming pattern is now unnecessary. This also makes it a bit easier to

1) run all such tests, for example by passing

`--gtest_filter=CrElementsTest.*` instead of

`--gtest_filter=CrElements*Test.All` previously

2) distinguish browser_tests (CrElementsTest.*) from

interactive_ui_tests (CrElementsFocusTest.*)



Bug: 1457360,1008122,1044390,997943

entry.title: [CT] Send initial scroll % signal
entry.content:
With this CL, RealtimeEngagementSignalObserver will send an

onGreatestScrollPercentageIncreased signal immediately after it is

created if the scroll percentage is > 0. This won't make a difference

until RealtimeEngagementSignalObserver's creation is deferred until an

EngagementSignalsCallback is set.



On the blink side, this CL updates RenderFrameMetadataObserver to push the RenderFrameMetadata to the browser if the RootScrollOffsetUpdateFrequency increased or was set for the first time.

entry.title: Enable the consistently passing tests in SecurityInterstitialTabHelperTest
entry.content:
This change is part of the effort to re-enable consistently passing

tests across the entire chromium.

If the tests are reasonable, please LGTM and I will proceed to submit

the change.

If the tests are unreasonable, please let me know and I will remove

them.



I do not inspect each individual test case, the idea is to run the

disabled tests on reviver builders

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/g/reviver/builders and use the

aggregated results to decide if a previously disabled test is now

consistently passing.



The following list shows how many times the changed tests were

*consistently* passing on the relevant builders.



components:components_unittests/SecurityInterstitialTabHelperTest.MultipleBlockingPages

146 fuchsia-fyi-arm64-dbg

173 fuchsia-fyi-x64-dbg

192 fuchsia-x64-rel

110 linux-lacros-tester-rel



Bug: 1380293

Change-Id: Ib54caa6b4641ebdaa5104a43c63f2c8a474458e6

entry.title: Use SkColorTable in cc::ColorFilter and make it thread safe
entry.content:
cc::ColorFilter can be used from multiple threads, and the lazy

creation of sk_color_filter_ (which was probably based on a concern

about the cost of TableARGBColorFilter?) was not thread safe.



Now use SkColorTable in TableColorFilter to reduce copy of the color

tables, and always create sk_color_filter_ in the constructors of

ColorFilter subclasses to make them thread safe.



Bug: 1451102, 1434335

Change-Id: Icca998fb949c5b579ff17b516de17e1a05a0d1f6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4654951

Reviewed-by: Michael Ludwig

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1164409}

entry.title: [Lacros a11y] ChromeVox injects gdocs script on startup
entry.content:
Google Docs (drive, sheets, etc) has an accessibility mode that

is required to be on to make pages accessible to screen readers,

including ChromeVox. ChromeVox in Ash informs gdocs tabs that

it is enabled by injecting an event, and ChromeVox in Lacros

does this for new gdocs tabs that are opened after ChromeVox

Helper is installed. This change ensures that gdocs tabs in Lacros

which were open before ChromeVox was enabled also have the

event injected, so that pre-existing Lacros gdocs tabs have

a11y mode turned on and automatically work with ChromeVox.



In short, this replicates behavior in Ash gdocs tabs from ChromeVox in

Lacros gdocs tabs, specifically see

chrome/browser/resources/chromeos/accessibility/chromevox/background/injected_script_loader.js.



For more, see go/lacros-embedded-a11y-extensions.



Also adds some required typescript definitions for the parts

of the extension API used by ChromeVox helper.



Bug: b/286413518

AX-Relnotes: Already open Lacros gdocs tabs turn on a11y when CVox enabled

Test: Manual (we don't have browsertests on live gdocs)

Change-Id: Ie361287b66da65bcbc8c64e600e8268b98e0873d

entry.title: cros_next: fix desk dialog modal
entry.content:
Desk dialogs are set with MODAL_TYPE_SYSTEM but they are not modal

to other windows. The cause is that we set root window to dialog

widget parent such that the dialog window is not parented to the

modal container.



This cl fixed it by setting the root window to widget context such

that the root window will make the dialog window parent to the

expected container.



Manually tested it and upload the screenshot in the bug comment.

entry.title: Fix style invalidation bug of logical combinations inside :has().
entry.content:
A sibling change doesn't trigger style invalidation properly when

a :has() contains a logical combination containing a sibling

relationship:









Must be green








CheckPseudoHasArgumentContext extracts sibling relationship

information from adjacent combinators inside ':has()' and provides

the information to SelectorChecker so that SelectorChecker marks

following flags:

- AncestorsOrAncestorSiblingsAffectedByHas

- SiblingsAffectedByHas



But the extraction logic haven't considered the adjacent combinators

or sibling relationships in the sub-selector of a logical combination

inside ':has()'. (e.g. :has(:is(.a + .b)), :has(:not(:nth-child(2))))



This CL fixes the bug by extracting sibling relationship information

from a sub-selector of :is(), :where() or :not() inside :has().



Bug: 1448531

Change-Id: Ifd5b0db33d357c530a5b8e467f2a7838e86f9528

entry.title: Changed ash/lacros to lock focus on accessbility bubble if it exists
entry.content:
This matches the behaviour on other platforms and is a lot more

intuitive. If a help/accessbility bubble is available, keyboard

navigation should require the user to either accept or dismiss it

before rotating focus within the browser.



Note that this change still allows focus to be rotated out of the

browser and onto other apps or the shelf.



Note 2: this change touches a generic code path, this is because

ChromeOS/Lacros and other platforms exclusively use one or the other.

This change effectively merges all platforms into a single codepath

so that they can share the same behaviour.



Bug: 1415449

Change-Id: Ic479913263820a6af732d670c9e254ac13b37c8a

entry.title: [mac] Fix child widget rendered behind its parent in fullscreen
entry.content:
A child widget might be rendered behind its parent in fullscreen. When

this happens, the child widget would receive the mouse event when

clicking on its parent. Given the inconsistency between rendering and

event routing this is likely caused by a bug in the macOS window server.



It seems that this can be fixed by explicitly calling StackAbove() to

place the child on top of its parent. I had an unsuccessful attempt

to add a regression test because IsWindowStackedAbove() is not returning

the correct result.



Bug: b/288013224

Change-Id: I2f74687eb5bc474379ca2075ca59e3aa7612ade0

entry.title: [CapturedMouseEvents] Implement basic IDL from the mouse events spec
entry.content:
A new web platform API to capture mouse events is being prototyped [2].

In this CL, the basic IDL (CapturedMouseEvent, its constructor as well

as a new oncapturedmousechange attribute on CaptureController) is

implemented under a the "CapturedMouseEvents" runtime flag. Note that

internally Blink does not fire any events on CaptureController yet,

this will be handled in a follow-up CL #4549484.



Corresponding web platform tests are written but are kept internal until

the situation evolves on the upstream side [2].



[1] https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/DYb5fXICJvo

[2] https://github.com/screen-share/mouse-events/issues/12



Bug: 1444712

Low-Coverage-Reason: Seems a bug in code coverage script, new lines covered by tests, except the dead code on !initialize.hasSurfaceX/Y

entry.title: Invalidate a LayoutText's AX object if it receives a non-zero fragment.
entry.content:
In addition to the added test, this deflakes DumpAccessibilityTreeTest, AccessibilitySub.



This CL uncovered a pre-existing problem where before and after pseudo

elements were never added for table elements. This was fixed by

disabling HTML-specific ax tree structures in

HasValidHTMLTableStructureAndLayout that have a non-Element

child with a layout object (e.g. a pseudo element or non-empty text

child). In such cases, we should fall back to regular node children,

to avoid losing a11y information about such nodes.



Bug: 1342801

entry.title: Fix BrowserAccessibilityCocoa leak
entry.content:
ARC convention is that C++ member functions neither consume nor return

Objective-C object references.



However, in AXPlatformNodeMac before ARCification, neither

ReleaseNativeWrapper() nor SetNativeWrapper() conformed to that

convention. ReleaseNativeWrapper() returned a reference,

SetNativeWrapper() consumed a reference, and its callers took that

into account.



When AXPlatformNodeMac was ARCified in https://crrev.com/c/4577142,

those methods were changed to conform to the new convention. The

caller of ReleaseNativeWrapper() was adjusted to take its own

reference as ReleaseNativeWrapper() no longer returned one. However,

the caller of SetNativeWrapper() was not adjusted. Therefore, the

reference that it assumed that SetNativeWrapper() would consume ended

up leaking.



This changes the caller of SetNativeWrapper() to release the reference

that is no longer needed. This fixes the leak.



Bug: 1457326

Change-Id: I35f49eb3af91d977acca16a371e86dd383f132fc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4657736

Auto-Submit: Avi Drissman

entry.title: Make CaptureController inherit from EventTarget
entry.content:
This CL makes CaptureController inherit from EventTarget as agreed in

[1] in order to be able to register listeners for

CapturedMouseEvents [2]. This change is web-exposed and cannot be

disabled by a runtime flag, so an intent-to-ship was sent [3]. It is

covered by the following web platform tests:



screen-capture/idlharness.https.window.js

screen-capture/capture-controller-event-target.https.window.js



Low-Coverage-Reason: Trace/InterfaceName not covered similarly to other EventTargets (InterfaceName called once for Window/WorkerGlobalScope, twice for debug logging and once with long callback [4]).



[1] https://github.com/w3c/mediacapture-screen-share/issues/268

[2] https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/DYb5fXICJvo

[3] https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/sDm7-oOmlPY

[4] scripts.name in https://github.com/w3c/longtasks/blob/main/loaf-explainer.md#how-a-loaf-entry-might-look-like



Bug: 1444712

entry.title: upgrade some tests for php8 compatability
entry.content:
Some changes are needed for php8 compatability.

New warnings have been added in php8. For most

tests these aren't a big deal. But for cors/http

or similar types of tests where the response is

decoded these warnings cause issues.



Doc below to go through analysis of one of these

which was previously fixed:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pl-Cx07qmOmzvpfZu9WtOGzd9kCNWFRbNoQL3TRpssk/edit?resourcekey=0-2jcWtsGA0bQBWliMu4A0jg



Tests fixed in this CL:

http/tests/devtools/network/cached-resource-destroyed-moved-to-storage.js

http/tests/devtools/network/network-cachedresources-with-same-urls.js

http/tests/devtools/network/network-timing.js

entry.title: Invalidate AX objects from table cells if their role might change
entry.content:
The role of a table cell depends on its siblings in a complex way

(see DecideRoleFromSiblings), so all siblings need to be invalidated

if any of them change their text content or are added.



In addition to the newly added test, this CL deflakes

DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityTableHeadersOnAllSides,

which sometimes fails on the bots for CL 4553316 due to timing

race conditions caused by the HTML parser.

entry.title: [iOS desktop promo] Fix UI label layout bug for certain platforms
entry.content:
Fixed a UI bug where the iOS promo bubble on desktop was broken on Mac

because the label was being squished. Used a FlexLayout instead of

BoxLayout. Also made a small change to make the "get started" button

always open a new tab, not depending on the !OverriddenCriteria.
